instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..
definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Touchbar Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Display issue
threads.message: Hello guys i'm working on this touchbar mac which has a strange problem, if i disconnect the battery and boot it up with power adapter i get backlight  if i try with battery connected backlight dims out any ideas what this could be. Never came across an issue like this before.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Touchbar Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Display issue
threads.message:
What happens if starts with battery only?
Check <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> signal in both cases.
Did PRAM reset?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Touchbar Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Display issue
threads.message: turns on with backlight then goes dim

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Touchbar Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Display issue
threads.message: I'm assuming when you say backlight you get image as well?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Touchbar Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Display issue
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> drops too?
It goes dim slightly, or immediately after turn on?
Backlight controls from touchbar have any effect?

Can you test another known good battery?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Touchbar Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Display issue
threads.message: Mark this one solved its a lcd issue.
